chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Concurrent with: Concurrent. Credit for 175 days.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with the victim R.S.H. dob 1/11/2005 or family.
Register as a sex offender for a period of five (5) years.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Harris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (12 pages) commencing 06/29/2015 SENTENCING TRANSCRIPT received and filed.

Defendant Antonio Harris in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Antonio Harris in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.
As to count 1 and count 2, CONCURRENT:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 175 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 15 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 21 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Register as a sex offender for a period of 5 years.
-No contact with the victim(RSH, dob 1-11-2005) or family.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded and is to report to Dodge Correctional.
Filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Pretrial Credit

Defendant Antonio Harris in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Antonio Harris in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility. Defendant remanded into the custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Filed by the state. Counts 1 and 2: exposing genitals, Wis. Stats. 948.10(1) and (1)(a), 939.50(3)(i), a class I felony.
At request of defense counsel, case is set for plea on 6-22-2015 at 8:15am.  OTP from HOC is needed.
State's Supplemental Witness List received and filed.
of DNA Evidence
of Additional Expert Testimony

Defendant Antonio Harris in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Antonio Harris in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter was to be resolved today with entry of a guilty plea.  State was going to file an amended information of 2 counts of Exposing Genitals.  Defendant is now rejecting the resolution and enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  
Case is adjourned to 6-29-2015 at 8:15 for jury trial.  The court will not accept any plea bargains or negotiations after today's date.
Parties are not requesting a final pretrial.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Antonio Harris not in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The court is informed that a resolution has been reached, however, Atty Harris has not completed the plea questionnaire form.
The court will adjourn case for plea on 4-10-2015 at 8:15 to allow time for form to be completed and for jury instruction to be attached.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Antonio Harris not in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter is set for trial today, however, there are 2 other cases also set and there is not another ADA available to try another case.
State and defense have had additional negotiations and matter may be resolved.  Case is set for 4-7-2015 at 8:15 for plea
Proposed Jury Instructions filed by defense

Defendant Antonio Harris in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Antonio Harris in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Standard Motions in Limine have been filed.  There is a stipulation that the forensic interview video can be used at trial.
Case remains in trial posture for 4-6-2015.
DEFENDANT'S PROPOSED JURY INSTRUCTIONS

Defendant Antonio Harris in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Antonio Harris in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Arguments heard as to bail. Court denied defense motion. Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Filed, Motion for Reduction of Bail.

Defendant Antonio Harris in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Antonio Harris in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with:  RSH (DOB: 1/11/2005); AC ( DOB 9/3/2003); KJ (DOB: 6/24/2000) ; SHAWNTEL L; KAREN C.
NO UNSUPERVISED CONTACT WITH CHILDEN UNDER AGE 14.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Antonio Harris in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Antonio Harris in custody.  Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.    Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
